title: Melanie Griffith is feeling herself as she owns lingerie selfies
text:
Melanie wore a set of black lingerie (Picture: Instagram)

Melanie Griffith is absolutely feeling herself this week, as she wore a set of black lingerie for a series of new snaps – and leaving fans stunned in the process.

The 62-year-old actress is showing us all that she has still got it after all these years, as she took to Instagram to share a picture of her sporting underwear courtesy of The Kit – a repost from the brand’s own Instagram account, where they also shared an additional shot of her.

As she gave a shout out to the lingerie set’s designers, Jamie Mizrahi and Simon Harouche, she wrote: ‘So these 2 awesome, creative, incredibily chic stylists… @sweetbabyjamie and @simoneharouche have started this amazing new lingerie line @thekitundergatments.’

She later enthused that she ‘loves everything’ the company has designed, as she encouraged her followers to lend their support to them.

‘I love everything they have made and btw want one of each!’ she added. ‘They also donate portion of anything you buy to charity. FOLLOW THEM!!!’

Fans were left very impressed by the picture, taking to the comments to share their thoughts and reactions.

‘How do you stay so spectacular?’ one fan questioned.

‘You are as hot as ever!’ another wrote.

The lingerie was deigned by The Kit (Picture: Instagram)

Fans were left very impressed (Picture: Instagram)

‘I am impressed!’ one fan commented.

‘Wow!! Such a babe!!’ another posted, alongside a string of heart-eyed emojis.

‘You look exactly the same as in The Working Girl!!!! Gorgeous,’ another added, as they made reference to Melanie’s role in the iconic 1988 film.

And although these snaps prove she is still a pretty confident woman, she previously opened up about having surgery to remove skin cancer from her nose.

‘It’s a scary thing when you’re an actress and you depend on your face for work,’ she told InStyle magazine.

‘But I realise I have to put a Band-Aid on it, and it’s fine. I just look like a dork.’
